To help you complete this, open the ET1 form, ACAS certificate and other documents in the Document tab (opens in a new tab).

This response must be completed and submitted within 28 days of the date of the claim form being sent by the tribunal.

You must provide your response to the claim even if you believe that another respondent is liable.

If you do not provide a response, a judgment may be issued against you without a hearing. If you consider another person or company maybe liable, you should still submit a response. You will have a chance in this response to explain why you think someone else may be liable.

It will help the tribunal and you as the respresentative if you have: 

* the claimant's employment start and end dates, hours of work and notice period
* details of claimant's pay and benefits, before and after tax
* your response to the claim, which you can upload in document format with a text field for accompanying information

### How to fill in this form

* read the questions carefully to make sure you're providing your details (as the representative) or the respondent's details
* optional questions will be marked as such
* you can review and edit your answers before you submit the form
What is the correct name of the claimant?
This will be the respondent recorded in ET1 that you're representing.

If you consider another person or company may be liable, you should still submit a response.

You will have a chance in this form to explain why you think someone else may be liable.
Enter the respondent's registered or legal name
Enter the company number if applicable
What type of employer is the respondent?
If individual, what is their preferred title?
Name of contact at respondent's address if not you as the representative
What is your contact phone number?
HintText: Where we can contact you (as the representative) during the day. For international numbers include the country code.

Label: How would you prefer to be contacted?
HintText: In most circumstances the tribunal will communicate by email. If you need communication by post, please tell us why.

Label: Provide a reason why you have selected post

The parties can express their preference of in-person, video or phone hearings.

Requests have to be agreed by a judge and it can depend on the type of hearing. If the case goes to a final hearing, this will normally be in-person but parties will be informed in advance.
Which types of hearing can you, as the representative, attend?
Which types of hearing can the respondent attend?
How many people does the respondent employ in Great Britain?
HintText:
It can help the tribunal to have an indication of the employer's size.

Enter a rough amount in digits or leave blank if you're not sure

Label: Does the respondent have more than one site in Great Britain?
How many people are employed at the place where the claimant worked?
HintText: Enter a rough amount in digits or leave blank if you're not sure

Label: Do you agree with the details given by the claimant about early conciliation with Acas?
Why do you disagree with the Acas conciliation details given?
HintText: For example, you may consider that the claimant gave an incorrect Acas early conciliation number of that they were wrong to say they were exempt from early conciliation.
